SASKATCHEWAN ARCHIVES QUESTIONNAIRES

No. 2

PIONEER EXPERIENCES: A GENERAL QUESTIONNAIRE

NOTE: Please print all proper names and place names in capital letters. If you are not sure the name is correct as you have given it, please say so. It is quite acceptable to have someone else do the writing at your dictation.

1. Your full name: Robert Ashton Mollard

2. Your address: W.A.T. Road, Sask.

3. Date: May 3, 1962

4. Where were you born? (Give name of place and country): Fairy Hill, Assiniboia, Canada

5. What was your father's name and occupation?: Farmer - Rancher (Livestock)

6. When did you come to Saskatchewan? (Give month and year): Born here Feb. 5, 1891

7. Mention any other places where you lived before coming to Saskatchewan, giving dates wherever possible:

8. How old were you when you first came to Western Canada? (You do not need to answer this question if you would rather not or you may use "I was a small child," "I was in my teens," etc.)

9. What were your reasons for coming West?

   - About 3rd second son
   - Born here
   - Father & mother must have agreed
   - That's how it should come
   - Living here

10. How did you learn about the West? (Through other people? Reading about it? Railroad or government information?)

    Through hard-earned experience

   - No. 9: I HAD TO MOVE. MUST HAVE AGREED
   - THAT. SHOULD COME.

    THROUGH HARD EARNED EXPERIENCE
11. What did your friends and relatives think of your decision to come to Western Canada?

12. Did you travel by yourself or with a party (family, friends or other group)?

13. What means of transportation did you use?

14. What incidents of the journey West do you remember? (People you met on the way/meetings with Indians/adventures on the journey/accidents or other excitement, etc.)

MEETING WITH INDIANS WAS ONE OF MY FIRST AND EARLIEST EXPERIENCES BECAUSE I WAS BORN & LIVED ADJACENT TO THREE INDIAN RESERVATIONS.

15. Where did you first stay when you arrived in Saskatchewan?

Gairy Hill, Assiniboia

16. Where did you settle or take up land?

Watrous, Saskatchewan

Regina, Saskatchewan

Joy Leighton Hill, Assiniboia (now Saskatchewan)

FARMING

MARRIED: NELLIE L. MEYER + HOSKIN

21. Did anyone else come to Saskatchewan because of your recommendation as a place to settle?

Not me - but many came west.

Because of my family's recommendation.

22. If other members of your family (brothers, sisters, parents, etc.) came West, tell when they came and where they settled.

All born in Assiniboia.

Parents came west.

Father - 1882. Married 1886.

Mother - 1884.

23. Is there any particular experience of pioneer days that stands out in your memory which you would like to record?

Living as a small boy in the Oppelt Valley among beside Indians who were almost our only neighbors.

My father got a long very well with the Indians. After the rebellion it took the Indians a couple of years to adjust to their new curtailment.

24. Did you travel about much in the early years? (for business, attending church, visiting friends, etc.) How often? How far? By what means of travel?

Regina was limited - large by travel was by horse.

16 Visiting neighbors.

All travel was by wagon.

Democrat or buggy. This may we had a buckboard. I have been a Nick name - J would not know it.

Mainly CPR. Manila. Would say the slower qualifier.

23. Is there any particular experience of pioneer days that stands out in your memory which you would like to record?

Living as a small boy in the opelle valley among beside Indians who were almost our only neighbors. My father got a long very well with the Indians. After the rebellion it took the Indians a couple of years to adjust to their new curtailment.

24. Did you travel about much in the early years? (For business, attending church, visiting friends, etc.)

How far? By what means of travel? How often?

Regina was limited - large city travel was limited to horses.

15 Visiting neighbors.

All travel was by horse or wagon. We had a buckboard. This may have been a nick name - I wouldn't know.

WATERS

GARNED CONTINUOUSLY TREN 1908-1938
ON SAME HOME STEAD - ARM.

29. How often did you shop in the early days? ONCE A WEEK.

ABOUT THIS TIME OF THE FIRST WORLD WAR
1941/48

VERY RARE DID WE BUY THROUGH MAIL
ORDER - NO CHANGE
WE SUPPORTED HOME TOWN MERCHANTS

(School districts, Post Offices, villages, railway stations, creeks, hills, etc.) Try to give: (1) name and occupation of person suggesting place-name, (2) origin and meaning of the name, (3) date of its adoption, (4) any changes in names since the first name was given, date and reason for change. Names:

- **Manitou**: Named after Mr. Harold Wilson.

39. Questions regarding historical source materials:
Do you have in your possession or do you know the whereabouts of diaries, old letters, old posters and programs, minute books of community organizations, old pamphlets, old photographs, written recollections and reminiscences? (Describe.)

I have one calendar (1935) with a colored photo of "The Summer I Pound Miter" on it. It was given at the year (1885) by name and photos of all farmers and military attending all on the farm.

Would you or the person who owns them either:

(1) be willing to lend them to the Provincial Archivist for copying?
(2) be willing to present them to the Archives Division of the Legislative Library, Regina,
or the Archives Office at the University in Saskatoon?

(Indicate your preference, if any)

Between the years 1891 and 1962 which has been transformed from a wilderness into a modern habituation from prairie lands to modern highways from pioneer families from farming with new settlers.
